column4: when you installed ubunti did you do a side-by-side installation?
no, i did a custom partion
can you fdisk it and still see the windows partition?
ya, i got it mounted, and i can see all the files in the partition, only problem is i dont see a option for it boot into windows
you will have to edit grub which i can't tell you how to do BUT i do have it bookmarked, hang on
ya, i have been trying to mess around with grub for sometime but cant do anything. tried putting a chain loader but it doesnt seem to help, but maybe your bookmark ill help
http://www.dedoimedo.com/computers/grub-2.html
thanks, i will see if that helps, do u know somewhere i can talk to someone who might know more about grub2?
this is the place - what you do is ask your question every 5 mins - ppl are coming in and out all the time
aah, ok, thanks a lot, i will keep trying my luck
i have done it with original grub, it's not real comp,licated
do u mean grub legacy (the one before this crappy version2) or do u mean grub 2?
read the link i gave you - i think there is enough info to do what you want
thanks man
you need to manually edit /boot/grup/grub.cfg and add an entry for the windows partition - i do not know the params
yup, tried doing that but it just says "no such partition" when i try to boot from it or just puts a blinkor in the top left corner and just sits there
i have to run off to the dentist, good luck
ouch good luck to you
final thought - the boot block for windows might be hosed
what do i do about that? thats what i have been fearing
one last thing i can think of - you are specifying the wrong partition
grub starts counting from 0, fdisk starts at 1.  read that link i gave you.  and now i do have to go good luck
